name: despoliation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of despoiling something (= making a place less attractive by damaging it or taking things away): despoliation of Mining provides local employment, but its despoliation of the landscape is no longer acceptable. These pioneering activists exposed the horrors of environmental despoliation.
More examplesFewer examplesThere was widespread despoliation of the woodland by local landowners. They argue that a logical way to avoid despoliation of the countryside is to restore urban areas.The state encouraged the development of renewable forms of energy, and protected the coastline from despoliation and development.
